verses.kjv: I will stand upon my watch, and set me upon the tower, and will watch to see what he will say unto me, and what I shall answer when I am reproved.
verses.ct: I will take my position at my guard post and station myself on the watchtower. I will keep looking to see what he will say to me and how I should respond when my complaint is answered.

verses.kjv: And the LORD answered me, and said, Write the vision, and make it plain upon tables, that he may run that readeth it.
verses.ct: The LORD replied to me: "Record this vision and write it clearly on tablets so that anyone who reads it can spread the message quickly."

verses.kjv: For the vision is yet for an appointed time, but at the end it shall speak, and not lie: though it tarry, wait for it; because it will surely come, it will not tarry.
verses.ct: "The vision points to a future time that has been set. It rushes toward its fulfillment and will not prove false. Even if it seems slow in coming, wait for it — because it will certainly arrive and will not be delayed."

verses.kjv: Behold, his soul which is lifted up is not upright in him: but the just shall live by his faith.
verses.ct: "Look — the person who is arrogant does not have an upright soul. But the righteous person will live by his faith."

verses.kjv: Yea also, because he transgresseth by wine, he is a proud man, neither keepeth at home, who enlargeth his desire as hell, and is as death, and cannot be satisfied, but gathereth unto him all nations, and heapeth unto him all people:
verses.ct: "Furthermore, wine betrays the arrogant man. He is restless and never stays home. He expands his appetite like the grave and is as greedy as death itself, never satisfied. He gathers every nation to himself and collects all peoples as his own."

verses.kjv: Shall not all these take up a parable against him, and a taunting proverb against him, and say, Woe to him that increaseth that which is not his! how long? and to him that ladeth himself with thick clay!
verses.ct: "Won't all of these conquered peoples mock him with ridicule and taunting songs? They will say, 'Disaster is coming to the one who piles up what doesn't belong to him! How long will this go on? He loads himself down with goods taken as pledges!'"

verses.kjv: Shall they not rise up suddenly that shall bite thee, and awake that shall vex thee, and thou shalt be for booties unto them?
verses.ct: "Won't your creditors suddenly rise up? Won't those who torment you wake up? You will become plunder for them."

verses.kjv: Because thou hast spoiled many nations, all the remnant of the people shall spoil thee; because of men’s blood, and for the violence of the land, of the city, and of all that dwell therein.
verses.ct: "Because you have looted many nations, all the surviving peoples will loot you — on account of the human blood you shed and the violence you brought against lands and cities and everyone living in them."

verses.kjv: Woe to him that coveteth an evil covetousness to his house, that he may set his nest on high, that he may be delivered from the power of evil!
verses.ct: "Disaster is coming to the one who builds his house through unjust gain, setting his nest up high, thinking he can escape the reach of disaster!"

verses.kjv: Thou hast consulted shame to thy house by cutting off many people, and hast sinned against thy soul.
verses.ct: "You have brought shame on your own household by destroying many peoples, and you have sinned against your own soul."

verses.kjv: For the stone shall cry out of the wall, and the beam out of the timber shall answer it.
verses.ct: "The very stones in the wall will cry out in accusation, and the wooden beams will echo the charge."

verses.kjv: Woe to him that buildeth a town with blood, and stablisheth a city by iniquity!
verses.ct: "Disaster is coming to the one who builds a city with bloodshed and establishes a town through injustice!"

verses.kjv: Behold, is it not of the LORD of hosts that the people shall labour in the very fire, and the people shall weary themselves for very vanity?
verses.ct: "Hasn't the LORD of Armies determined that the labor of the peoples will only fuel the fire, and that nations exhaust themselves for absolutely nothing?"

verses.kjv: For the earth shall be filled with the knowledge of the glory of the LORD, as the waters cover the sea.
verses.ct: "For the earth will be filled with the knowledge of the glory of the LORD, just as water fills the sea."

verses.kjv: Woe unto him that giveth his neighbour drink, that puttest thy bottle to him, and makest him drunken also, that thou mayest look on their nakedness!
verses.ct: "Disaster is coming to the one who makes his neighbor drink, pouring out your wine for them and getting them drunk just so you can see them stripped and humiliated!"

verses.kjv: Thou art filled with shame for glory: drink thou also, and let thy foreskin be uncovered: the cup of the LORD’s right hand shall be turned unto thee, and shameful spewing shall be on thy glory.
verses.ct: "You will be filled with disgrace instead of honor. Now it's your turn to drink and be exposed! The cup in the LORD's right hand is coming around to you, and utter humiliation will cover your so-called glory."

verses.kjv: For the violence of Lebanon shall cover thee, and the spoil of beasts, which made them afraid, because of men’s blood, and for the violence of the land, of the city, and of all that dwell therein.
verses.ct: "The violence you brought against Lebanon will overwhelm you, and the destruction of its animals will terrify you — all because of the human blood you shed and the violence you brought against lands and cities and everyone living in them."

verses.kjv: What profiteth the graven image that the maker thereof hath graven it; the molten image, and a teacher of lies, that the maker of his work trusteth therein, to make dumb idols?
verses.ct: "What good is a carved idol that its maker has shaped? What use is a metal image — a teacher of lies? The craftsman trusts in his own creation, only to produce speechless idols that cannot do anything."

verses.kjv: Woe unto him that saith to the wood, Awake; to the dumb stone, Arise, it shall teach! Behold, it is laid over with gold and silver, and there is no breath at all in the midst of it.
verses.ct: "Disaster is coming to the one who says to a piece of wood, 'Wake up!' or to a silent stone, 'Get up and teach us!' Look at it — it may be covered in gold and silver, but there is no life in it at all."

verses.kjv: But the LORD is in his holy temple: let all the earth keep silence before him.
verses.ct: But the LORD is in his holy temple. Let the entire earth be silent in his presence.
